title: Processing Metadata
description: Metadata documenting the processing pipeline execution for a document. Captures which processor was used, timing information, and any warnings encountered during format conversion. This enables reproducibility tracking and quality monitoring. Processing requirements: MUST preserve section hierarchy, MUST convert tables to GitHub-Flavoured Markdown, MUST preserve LaTeX equations ($...$ and $$...$$), SHOULD maintain cross-references and citations, MUST handle multi-column layouts. Content filtering: strip embedded images (unless figure extraction enabled), remove navigation elements/headers/footers, exclude adverts/boilerplate, eliminate duplicate content blocks.

processor_used.description: Name and version of the processor that converted this document to markdown. Format SHOULD be 'processor_name/version' (e.g., 'docling/1.2.3', 'pandoc/2.19'). Used for tracking processing tool versions and debugging conversion issues.

processing_timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when processing started. Used for tracking pipeline performance and correlating with logs.

processing_duration.description: Duration of processing in seconds (floating point). Measures time from processing start to completion. Used for performance monitoring and identifying bottlenecks.

conversion_warnings.description: Array of warning messages generated during format conversion. Each string describes a non-fatal issue encountered (e.g., 'Failed to parse equation on line 42', 'Table structure ambiguous'). Empty array indicates no warnings. Used for quality assessment and identifying documents requiring manual review.
